benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Retrieve invoice item custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Successful retrieval for valid invoiceItemId returning 200 with a JSON array; audit levels NONE (default), FULL, and MINIMAL exercised.
Empty Response: Invoice item with no custom fields returns 200 and an empty array.
Query Parameters: Audit enum values validated (FULL, MINIMAL, NONE), default behavior when omitted, invalid value rejected, and unsupported extra parameters ignored.
Story-mandated errors: 400 for invalid UUID format and 404 for non-existent invoice item are covered.
Resilience: Service/database unavailability (503), dependency failure (503), and timeout (504) scenarios are included.
Performance/Concurrency: Large result sets and parallel request behavior are exercised with response time expectations.
Backward compatibility: Older Accept header scenario present to ensure compatibility.
Security: Inputs with SQL injection/XSS are rejected with appropriate client errors.
JSON validity: Response body asserted to be valid JSON.
gaps: Pagination: No explicit assertion that the endpoint is unpaginated or coverage for paging behavior with large datasets (ensure no truncation or presence/absence of pagination headers).
Caching Behavior: Missing checks for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control and conditional GET flow (304 Not Modified).
Rate Limiting: No scenarios to validate throttling/429 Too Many Requests and related headers under burst traffic.
Content negotiation/headers: No explicit assertion that Content-Type is application/json; limited Accept handling and no negative case (e.g., 406 for unsupported media types if applicable).
Response schema validation: No strict validation against #/definitions/CustomField (required fields, data types, id is uuid, objectType=INVOICE_ITEM, objectId matches path, value constraints).
Audit semantics: Exact differences between FULL vs MINIMAL are not validated; potential ambiguity between TC01 and TC13 regarding whether NONE returns any audit info.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized users (if RBAC applies).
Error response envelope: Error payload structure (code/message) and consistency across 400/404/503/504 not asserted.
URL and input edge cases: No tests for trailing slash, repeated audit parameters precedence, case sensitivity (e.g., audit=full), or URL-encoded IDs.
Produces contract: No explicit verification that responses comply with produces application/json including charset.
recommendations: Add caching tests: capture ETag/Last-Modified and validate conditional GET returning 304; assert appropriate Cache-Control directives.
Introduce rate-limiting scenarios: generate burst traffic to verify 429 Too Many Requests and presence of Retry-After and any X-RateLimit-* headers.
Clarify pagination: if unpaginated, add a test asserting all custom fields are returned without paging headers; if paginated, add limit/offset and Link header coverage.
Assert headers and negotiation: check Content-Type=application/json; verify Accept handling for application/json and 406 for unsupported types (if implemented).
Add schema validation against CustomField definition: required fields, types, id as uuid, objectType INVOICE_ITEM, objectId equals invoiceItemId; ensure no extraneous fields.
Tighten audit-level validation: for FULL/MINIMAL verify expected audit fields; for NONE assert audit data is absent; align TC01 and TC13 to remove ambiguity.
Include a 403 Forbidden scenario for insufficient permissions if the API enforces RBAC.
Standardize error payload checks: validate error envelope (code, message) and Content-Type for 400/404/503/504.
Cover URL/input edge cases: trailing slash handling, duplicate audit params precedence, case sensitivity of audit values, percent-encoded UUIDs.
Optionally strengthen backward-compatibility: assert versioning/capability headers if defined and ensure response remains compatible across Accept variants.
